RESOLVED_ENTITIES.United States Court of Appeals for the F: United States Court of Appeals for the Fifth Circuit
RESOLVED_ENTITIES.the Court: United States Court of Appeals for the Fifth Circuit
RESOLVED_ENTITIES.Court: United States Court of Appeals for the Fifth Circuit

AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.United States: country where the case is being tried, differentiated from police states
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.United States District Court: court that determined relevance and propriety of post-trial questioning, judged the case, provided initial instructions to the jury, and gave the modified Allen charge, convicted Maria De Jesus Garcia, denied the extension motion and made oral findings of fact regarding the constitutionality of the stop and search
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.United States Government: government whose agents conducted the stop and search, defendant in the appeal, responsible for enforcing laws through governmental enforcement agents
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.United States Border Patrol: law enforcement agency whose agents stopped Maria De Jesus Garcia's pickup truck, and whose actions are being reviewed under the Brignoni-Ponce test
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.United States Court of Appeals for the F: court that has repeatedly stated the importance of the Brignoni-Ponce test in determining reasonable suspicion for stops near the United States-Mexican border
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.United States-Mexico Border: geographic location related to the case, relevant for determining the origin of vehicles and individuals, used as a reference point for distance calculation
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Brignoni-Ponce Standard: legal standard or precedent used to determine reasonable suspicion in immigration inspections and stops, may be satisfied if other articulable facts reasonably warrant suspicion
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.United States District Court Jury: jury that was given the Allen charge after indicating deadlock, deliberated for approximately three hours after receiving the charge, and requested a clarification of the United States district court's initial instructions
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.United States Federal Courts: courts that have not favored interrogations of jurors except where there is some showing of illegal or prejudicial intrusion into the jury process
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Maria De Jesus Garcia: defendant in the case whose motion to interview jurors was denied by the United States district court judge, owner of a pickup truck used in the case
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Maria De Jesus Garcia's Vehicle: pickup truck driven by Maria De Jesus Garcia, subject of a stop and search by border patrol agents where occupants exhibited suspicious behavior, including hygienic appearances that were considered in assessing reasonable suspicion for the stop, had passengers who attempted to hide when a light was shone into the vehicle, was traveling at forty to forty-five miles per hour on Interstate Highway 35, had squashed tires, angled headlights, and was weaving
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Interstate Highway 35: highway where Maria De Jesus Garcia was stopped, known as a common smuggling route
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.United States District Court Judge: judge who denied a defense motion for mistrial and instructed the jury to continue deliberation, made oral findings of fact regarding the constitutionality of the stop and search
